intro: Hylebia bungeana, commonly known as the Bunge's hylea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hylebia bungeana is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
